repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
@scoder You had opinions regarding documentation on my other PR. Do you mind if I use your judgement here?

the literal ticket was: [this ](https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3069) example doesn't work, which I fixed. 

the extra problem: I fixed it but this path (specifying `language` to the `cythonize` function) is deprecated (https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/93afd3c980907c9350c2bc1bcd9aa639a31a2ee9/Cython/Build/Dependencies.py#L727-L729).

I added a note in my second commit in this PR. Do you want to keep this in the documentation ? Do you want to strengthen the deprecation note? Is there a different style I should use? 

Thanks,
Andrew Kettmann

comment_data.body: I think this meant to go in https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/7137?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,158 +1,22 @@
-# Makefile for Sphinx documentation
+# Minimal makefile for Sphinx documentation

commit.message: regenerated a new Makefile, make.bat, conf.py, these are stock. I will customize them next.
Sphinx wants these files in docs/src
better exceptioning in case this path breaks.

Revert "Sphinx wants these files in docs/src"

This reverts commit 31a6fe0be82aaf75d5c6f3699a763caac00f8b37.
